intro: Relhania corymbosa, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found growing on the branches of trees such as *Eucalyptus* and *Cecropia*. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers that are pollinated by insects. Its berries are orange-red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Relhania corymbosa plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species.
